moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. d3: Also possible are Ng5, Nc3 or O-O
moves.4... h6: Trying to avoid any Loli Attack Or Fried Liver or some deadly knight sac on f7.
moves.5. Nc3 a6: Trying to keep hold of the b5 square to avoid any Nb5 or Bb5. I can also play b5 attacking the bishop and then i'll play Bb7 but this pawn structure will be crippled by a4
moves.6. a3 Bc5 7. h3 d6 8. Bd2 Qe7 9. Qc1: I believe this was trying to get rid of pawn cover if i castle short.
moves.9... Be6 10. Bxe6 Qxe6 11. b4 Ba7 12. g4: A Pawn Storm on both sides?
moves.12... Nd4 13. Nh4 g6 14. g5 hxg5 15. Bxg: This is a blunder! I am allowed to take the knight on h4...
moves.16... Rxh4: Because since the defense of f3 is now gone, I can freely place my knight on f3 and unleash a devastating king ,queen fork.  But Rook Vs Queen isn't entirely lost. I could always make a blunder just as i always do.
moves.20. Qg2 Rxh1+ 21. Qxh1 Ng4 22. Nd1 f5 23: Forked his king and Knight, well not really. Good to exchange pieces off.
Guess he saw what i was trying to do
moves.29... Qh3 30. Kf2: Now the rook on a1 will fall in a few moves.
moves.30... Qg3+ 31. Ke2 Rh2+ 32. Kd1 Rh1+: Also possible was 32.Qg1+ Qe1 33.Qxe1+ Kxe1 34. Rh1+ Kf2 or Ke2 35. Rxa1
